reactor.rx

Interface Controls

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Action, BatchAction, Broadcaster, BufferAction, BufferShiftAction, BufferShiftWhenAction, BufferWhenAction, CacheAction, CallbackAction, CombineAction, ConcatAction, CountAction, DefaultIfEmptyAction, DematerializeAction, DistinctUntilChangedAction, DynamicMergeAction, ElapsedAction, ErrorAction, ErrorReturnAction, ErrorWithValueAction, FallbackAction, FanInAction, FilterAction, FinallyAction, FlowControlAction, GroupByAction, IgnoreErrorAction, LastAction, LoggerAction, MapAction, MaterializeAction, MergeAction, ObservableAction, ReduceByKeyAction, RepeatAction, RepeatWhenAction, RetryAction, RetryWhenAction, SampleAction, ScanAction, ScanByKeyAction, SkipAction, SkipUntilTimeout, SortAction, SplitAction, StreamStateCallbackAction, SwitchAction, TakeAction, TakeUntilTimeout, TapAndControls, TerminalCallbackAction, ThrottleRequestAction, ThrottleRequestWhenAction, TimeoutAction, TimestampAction, WindowAction, WindowShiftAction, WindowShiftWhenAction, WindowWhenAction, ZipAction

    public interface Controls
    An interface generally associated with a Stream terminal action such as Stream.consume(reactor.fn.Consumer)
    Since:
    2.0
    Author:
    Stephane Maldini

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancel()
      Stop consuming signals from upstream.
      StreamUtils.StreamVisitor debug()
      Parse the materialized upstream source to fetch a materialized map form which allows for graph-style printing.
      boolean isPublishing()
      Check if the current stream is emitting any signal.
      void requestMore(long n)
      Request the next n elements from the source
      void start()
      Usually requests Long.MAX_VALUE, which instructs a stream to never end until completed or cancelled.

    • Method Detail

      • requestMore

        void requestMore(long n)
        Request the next n elements from the source
        Parameters:
        n - the number of elements to request

      • start

        void start()
        Usually requests Long.MAX_VALUE, which instructs a stream to never end until completed or cancelled.

      • cancel

        void cancel()
        Stop consuming signals from upstream. Cancel should not be considered blocking, but usually it happens to be rather immediate as it will be updating PushSubscription.terminated flag.

      • isPublishing

        boolean isPublishing()
        Check if the current stream is emitting any signal.

      • debug

        StreamUtils.StreamVisitor debug()
        Parse the materialized upstream source to fetch a materialized map form which allows for graph-style printing.
        Returns:
        StreamUtils.StreamVisitor a Debug container for the current source
